study_plan_entry.title: Numerical Methods for Physical Properties Evaluation

free_text.Learning outcomes: To learn the numerical methods that are used to evaluate thermophysical properties of pure components and mixtures and there applications for fluid phase changes and separation problems.
free_text.Content: Day 1 :[br/]How nanoscale interactions influence the macroscale properties[br/]Concept of equation of state[br/]Ideal behaviour and residual properties[br/]Corresponding state principle[br/]How equations of state are designed[br/]Review of some equations of state (virial, BWR type, cubic equations)[br/][br/]Day 2 :[br/]Mixture properties[br/]Ideal mixture and excess properties[br/]Phase equilibria[br/]Application of equations of state to mixtures[br/][br/]Day 3 :[br/]Excess properties for strongly nonideal mixtures[br/]Excess Gibbs free energy models :[br/][li]Scatchard-Hildebrand[br/][li]Wilson[br/][li]NRTL[br/][li]UNIQUAC[br/]Calculation of phase equilibria for strongly nonideal mixtures at moderate pressure[br/]Parameter estimation in phase equilibrium models[br/]Predictive method (UNIFAC, UNIQUAC)[br/][br/]Day 4 :[br/]Modelling strongly nonideal mixtures at high pressure[br/]Huron-Vidal mixing rules, MHV1, MHV2[br/]Coupling phase equililibria with chemical reaction : electrolyte models[br/]Modelling separation processes[br/][li]Flash separation[br/][li]Batch distillation[br/][li]Continuous distillation[br/]
free_text.Keywords: thermodynamic methods, physical properties of fluids and mixtures
